alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 3:18PM MDT until June 17 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL ELBERT COUNTY... At 318 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain had ended across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elbert and Fondis. This includes the following streams and drainages... West Kiowa Creek, Kiowa Creek, Wolf Creek, Wilson Creek, Key Creek, Spring Branch, West Bijou Creek, East Cherry Creek, Middle Bijou Creek, Gopher Creek, Comanche Creek, East Bijou Creek, Water Gulch and Running Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
